body.description: 2 products in 1 - The SURFboard SBG10 combines a DOCSIS 3.0 cable modem with an 802.11ac Wi-Fi router with 2 one-gigabit Ethernet ports. It has 16 downstream and 4 upstream channels and AC1600 Wi-Fi, making it a perfect choice for homes with less devices to manage. The all-in-one modem & Wi-Fi router combo means no more managing multiple devices and is best for Cable Internet Speed Plans up to 400 Mbps. Plus, it saves you money on monthly modem rental fees and fits easily into any home office.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: A high-speed internet experience that's quick, easy and economical The SURFboard SBG10 combines a DOCSIS 3.0 cable modem with an 802.11ac Wi-Fi router with 2 one-gigabit Ethernet ports. It has 16 downstream and 4 upstream channels and AC1600 Wi-Fi, making it a perfect choice for homes with less devices to manage. The all-in-one modem & Wi-Fi router combo means no more managing multiple devices and is best for Cable Internet Speed Plans up to 400 Mbps. Plus, it saves you money on monthly modem rental fees and fits easily into any home office. Two 1-Gigabit Ethernet Ports The SBG10 is equipped with two 1-gigabit Ethernet ports for ultra-fast wired networking. Perfect for connecting smart TVs, gaming consoles and more. Save money on monthly rental fees When you purchase an ARRIS SURFboard modem, you save money on monthly lease fees while equipping your home network with the latest technology. Simple setup and management with SURFboard Central App Setup has never been easier. Simply download the SURFboard Central app and follow the step-by-step instructions to get your modem up and running. No more calls to your Internet Service Provider to activate your modem. SURFboard Central takes you through that process to get you up and running quickly.

SBG10 (RB) SBG6950AC2 (RB) SBG7400AC2 (RB) SBG7600AC2 (RB) SBG8300 (RB) Best for Cable Internet Speed Plans Up to 400 Mbps Up to 400 Mbps Up to 600 Mbps Up to 800 Mbps Up to 1 Gbps DOCSIS Downstream x Upstream Channels 16 x 4 16 x 4 24 x 8 32 x 8 Up to 1 Gbps OFDM Downstream x Upstream Channels ― ― ― ― 2 x 2 Wi-Fi Speed AC1600 dual-band concurrent Wave 2 AC1900 dual-band concurrent Wave 2 AC2350 dual-band concurrent Wave 2 AC2350 dual-band concurrent Wave 2 AC2350 dual-band concurrent Gigabit Ethernet Ports 2 4 4 4 4 Multi-Gigabit Ethernet Ports ― ― ― ― ― SURFboard Central App ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works perfectly, great value.
reviews.reviewText: Don't waste money on Xfinity rental fees! This is the solution. Literally takes 20 mins to set up if you know what you're doing.Few tips:¹ Don't scan QR code. Type the CMAC # in manually.²You don't need to call Xfinity at all. Just set up through the Xfinity and surfboard app.³You can change the network name and password through the surfboard app. Don't listen to the reviews saying you can't.Good speed, no connection issues. Would recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Buy the refurbished
reviews.reviewText: Didn’t get a new one. Bought the refurbished and paid extra for a warranty that’s better than a new unit. Works flawlessly. It’s the only way to go

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Internet speed is non existent
reviews.reviewText: Set up was fine - but this does not work for me. I can’t get videos to load on my phone, multiple device cannot stream at once, everything is always loading - but as soon as I switch off the wifi and use data instead everything works - so therefore this modem is trash and I will be returning

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Headache to Activate from Xfinity
reviews.reviewText: It came promptly but had a headache to activate with Xfinity. Their reps chat thru the apps.The first one told me to return it to Amazon, as it is still tethered to an old account at Comcast.Last night another rep said he would try adding to my account and he apprised me he did. Today morning another rep gave me a heads-up that it is still tied to an old account. Frustrated I asked the rep to connect me to the manager, she then activated it under my account and untethered. Still, the internet did not work. After countless hours with advanced tech support, they were able to activate it. Still, the bandwidth comes out to be 68MB download on a 200MB account.I called the ARRIS help desk, and they were nice but told me if the cable is connected and ethernet is connected with the desktop and it is taking me to Xfinity activation,the burden lies at Xfinity to activate, which they ultimately did.It's working at half the bandwidth at 3 different speed tests. Spent around 8 hours . Kindly watch out with service providers if it is connected with old accounts.The seller should be responsible for a return.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: easy to use and set up. great wifi signal

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far So good
reviews.reviewText: Love this router so far and no more rental fees from the internet provider.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not recommended for those who are not tech savvy
reviews.reviewText: Oh wow what a mess this thing is. First problem I had was the ac adapter it came with was defective, I am using an extra I had lying around, knowing a thing or two about volts and amps helped. It came to me not reset as well, there is a reset button that is not labeled, pressed it with a sim key and it reset. Thank goodness I have a networking degree because there is also no instructions included. To start, read the label on the bottom, connect to the wireless network your laptop finds, and then go to 192.168.0.1 in your web browser. NO additional apps are needed, I don't know what people are talking about. Once you've got your wifi all configured with a password and whatnot, now call your internet provider and yell at the automated system for an agent. Tell the agent you need to activate your modem and BAM! internet. Now for the disappointment, I have Xfinity with a 200mbps plan. Only the Ethernet ports run at that speed, the wifi only supports 40mbps down. I now do not use the wifi and have a dedicated wireless access point.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars good, even as a refurbished unit
reviews.reviewText: Works fine with Comcast. Using for streaming TV in an unoccupied house to make it look lived it. Also can viewing live camera streams on our phone with it. Basically using it for remote home monitoring.
